item.name: Greater Wolf's Bane
entries: This poison is made from a special preparation of wolfsbane (also known as monkshood), lupines (also known as bluebonnet), foxglove, and hemlock. This poison has different effects based on the method of delivery:

items.name: Ingested or Injury
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

A werecreature subjected to this poison instead must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or it becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute, takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the werecreature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage. After three successful saves, all of the effects of the poison end.

If an afflicted werecreature subjected to a dose of this poison each round for 3 consecutive rounds fails the saving throw of each dose of poison, then they are cured of their lycantropic curse. If the werecreature regains hit points or the poison within them is neutralized between doses then the process for curing the lycanthropic curse is interrupted. A cured lycanthrope is {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours.

items.name: Inhaled
entries: This poison only affects dire wolves, wolves, werewolves, and dire werewolves that dont have total cover from and are within 60-ft of any open container with a full dose of this poison in it. This poison evaporates, neutralizing it, from an open container at a rate of 1 dose per 6 hours. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become frightened while in the affected area. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful the creature is immune to this poison while in the affected area.

item.name: Wolf's Bane
entries: This poison is made from a special preparation of wolfsbane (also known as monkshood) and only affects dire wolves, wolves, werewolves, and dire werewolves that dont have total cover from and are within 30-ft of any open container with a full dose of this poison in it. This poison evaporates, neutralizing it, from an open container at a rate of 1 dose per 6 hours. A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become frightened while in the affected area. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful the creature is immune to this poison while in the affected area.

item.name: Emerald of the Barded Shapechanger
entries: Etched with druidic runes, this 2-inch-diameter uncut emerald causes any armor or barding you wear to adjust to fit any form and size you take, while also preventing it from melding into your new form. Armor or barding worn retain all properties in the new form.

For this property to work, you must attach the emerald to your body by pressing the emerald against your skin for at least 10 minutes. Thereafter, the emerald can't be removed unless you detach it as an action or the emerald is severed from your main body. Not even an {@spell antimagic field} causes it to fall off. The emerald does fall off if your attunement to it ends. Armor or barding returns to its original size and shape when removed from you when your attunement to the emerald ends, and armor or barding that you cannot wear falls off.

item.name: Alchemy Jug (Sapphire)
entries: This ceramic jug appears to be able to hold a gallon of liquid and weighs 12 pounds whether full or empty. Sloshing sounds can be heard from within the jug when it is shaken, even if the jug is empty.

You can use an action and name one liquid from the table below to cause the jug to produce the chosen liquid. Afterward, you can uncork the jug as an action and pour that liquid out, up to 2 gallons per minute. The maximum amount of liquid the jug can produce depends on the liquid you named.
Once the jug starts producing a liquid, it can't produce a different one, or more of one that has reached its maximum, until the next dawn.

item.name: Amethyst of the Sizeshifter's Weapon
entries: Etched with primordial runes, this 1-inch-diameter uncut amethyst allows you to use an action to adjust how a {@filter simple or martial weapon|items|type=simple weapon;martial weapon|category=} is sized.

For this property to work, you must attach the amethyst to the weapon by pressing the amethyst against it for at least 10 minutes. Weapons with the amethyst attached are immune to other effects that change how the weapon is sized. Thereafter, the amethyst can't be removed unless you detach it as an action or the item is destroyed. Not even an {@spell antimagic field} causes it to fall off. The amethyst does fall off the weapon if your attunement to the amethyst ends. A weapon returns to its original size if the amethyst is no longer attached to it.
